title: Youngkhngdiddy
author: Youngkhngdiddy
created_time: June 27, 2023, 05:10:46 PMLast edit: June 27, 2023, 07:23:11 PM by Youngkhngdiddy
content: I've found out that many people are willing to know about bitcoin and other Cyptocurrencies but are scared to engage in it due to fear of the unknown or lack of lack of trust for it. I had a conversation with my neighbour yesterday and our discussion lead to talks about bitcoin, it got to a point where I asked her if she had an idea about bitcoin then her reply was no (tufiakwa) i no wan even know am because na scam, then I asked how, she said yes now na yahoo boys dey do bitcoin and I no go like put body for wetin them go scam me, it was so funny that I laughed, and later began to correct her statement. I started by letting her know about cryptocurrency, i gave her a breakdown saying that crypto currency is a digital currency that the transactions are decentralized that is they're not controlled by government authorities, then I told her bitcoin is the 1st Cryptocurrency that was created as an alternative to fiat currency for transactions of goods and services, that got her interest and she was like really, oboy I think say na scam o, then I told her no that asides being decentralized that bitcoin is trustworthy and safe and all she needs is a better understanding about it as well as investing and storing crypto with a good exchange. I created this post because I know cryptocurrency is vastly gaining audience around the world but there are many left behind who doesn't have idea about it, most of them due to ignorance have been scammed on wrong investments by bad actors, these persons can be anyone, your friend, uncle or even closer family members so it's our duty to teach  them about cryptocurrency to avoid the risk of falling for bad actors.

comments.body: The word scam have been attributed to bitcoin most of the time from people that have no knowledge about it because of those so called yahoo boys. I don’t know how they were able to link owning bitcoin and yahoo together and they are in no way related to one another. comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Yes, it's very good to always correct people in their state of misconception about Bitcoin or crypto generally, because if we see such people and don't correct them, they may still convince others to believe that Bitcoin is bad which can discourage them from investing into Bitcoin. Quite a lot of non-bitcoiners just have different thoughts about what they think Bitcoin is, and another thing that worries me is that some of them feel that Bitcoin is a get-rich-quick scheme. In my country, a lot of people also have all these kinds of misconceptions about Bitcoin. I was in the company of a group of friends one day as they were discussing Bitcoin, and one of them was saying that if you invest in Bitcoin, you will just make a sudden fortune. That's just what some people think.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on June 30, 2023, 01:04:15 PMYes, it's very good to always correct people in their state of misconception about Bitcoin or crypto generally, because if we see such people and don't correct them, they may still convince others to believe that Bitcoin is bad which can discourage them from investing into Bitcoin. Quite a lot of non-bitcoiners just have different thoughts about what they think Bitcoin is, and another thing that worries me is that some of them feel that Bitcoin is a get-rich-quick scheme. In my country, a lot of people also have all these kinds of misconceptions about Bitcoin. I was in the company of a group of friends one day as they were discussing Bitcoin, and one of them was saying that if you invest in Bitcoin, you will just make a sudden fortune. That's just what some people think.The fact is that, despite that always trying to avoid taking part in cryptocurrency-related arguments around by vicinity, it is still very important to set records straight and try to correct every misconception and at some point, it is very good to confront the naysayers who always try to paint Bitcoin black alongside other altcoins, and since Nigerians have been the most victimized people when it comes to cryptocurrency-related frauds e.g scam Bitcoin investments and other crypto-related schemes, this has made room for all kinds of misinformation, misinterpretation of Bitcoin and what it entails.So it has become very important to always clear the air when necessary and to engage in constructive discussion and to enlighting those who care to listen and gain knowledge on cryptocurrencies and their associated risks, and how to protect oneself from becoming a victim of the vad aspects of bitcoin and other altcoins.
